item.title: Irish Soda Bread
item.dc:creator: Maureen O'Reilly
item.description:
Ingredients

4 cups soft wheat flour

1/4 cup granulated sugar

1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder

2 heaping teaspoons caraway seeds

1 cup raisins (half golden, soaked in hot water for 15 minutes)

1/2 cup unsalted butter

1 1/3 cups whole buttermilk

1 egg

1 teaspoon baking soda

Directions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

  2. Combine in a large bowl 4 cups soft wheat flour, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 2 heaping teaspoons of caraway seeds, and 1 cup raisins (half golden, soaked in hot water for 15 minutes).

  3. Crumble in 1/2 cup unsalted butter with your fingers until the mixture is fragrant with butter, caraway and flour, and pieces of butter are pea-size or larger.

  4. In a second bowl, mix together 1 1/3 cups whole buttermilk, 1 egg and 1 teaspoon baking soda. Beat until foamy.

  5. Add to dry ingredients and combine to make a stiff dough, stopping just when flour disappears.

  6. Grease a 9-inch round pan (glass works well).

  7. Place dough in pan and lightly shape into a dome.

  8. Sprinkle liberally with flour.

  9. Using a sharp knife, cut a cross a half-inch deep into the top.

  10. Bake in preheated oven approximately 1 hour.

  11. Cool in pan 5 minutes, then turn out onto a rack to cool.

  12. Serve in thick slices with Irish butter and scalding hot tea.
